snippet: The Supreme Court ruled that second mortgages may not be voided if the property is worth less than the mortgage debt.
abstract: Supreme Court rules unanimously that second mortgages may not be voided if homeowners file for bankruptcy even if property is worth less than mortgage debt; ruling preserves important protection for lenders of mortgages and also ends option for homeowners with limited incomes and large amount of debt to get rid of properties that are underwater.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court ruled that second mortgages may not be voided if the property is worth less than the mortgage debt.

headline.main: Justices Curb Bankruptcy Filers’ Ability to Have Second Mortgages Canceled
headline.print_headline: Justices Curb Bankruptcy Filers’ Ability to Have Second Mortgages Canceled
